items.title: AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'get'
items.body:
I get an error `AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'get'` with following stack:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "confluence_projects_dashboard.py", line 261, in <module>
    main()
  File "confluence_projects_dashboard.py", line 212, in main
    parse_dir(pargs.location)
  File "confluence_projects_dashboard.py", line 220, in parse_dir
    main_page_id = confluence.get_page_id(SPACENAME, MAINPAGE)
  File "/projects/confluence/venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/atlassian/confluence.py", line 87, in get_page_id
    return (self.get_page_by_title(space, title) or {}).get('id')
  File "/projects/confluence/venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/atlassian/confluence.py", line 151, in get_page_by_title
    return (self.get(url, params=params) or {}).get('results')[0]
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'get'
```
What is that and how to fix it?

items.title: 'ApiValueError' object is not callable when 400 returned
items.body:
Following error happened:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/data/home/davendu/miniconda3/envs/wiki_import/lib/python3.8/site-packages/atlassian/confluence.py", line 1058, in update_page
    response = self.put('rest/api/content/{0}'.format(page_id), data=data)
  File "/data/home/davendu/miniconda3/envs/wiki_import/lib/python3.8/site-packages/atlassian/rest_client.py", line 203, in put
    response = self.request('PUT', path=path, data=data, headers=headers, files=files, params=params,
  File "/data/home/davendu/miniconda3/envs/wiki_import/lib/python3.8/site-packages/atlassian/rest_client.py", line 161, in request
    response.raise_for_status()
  File "/data/home/davendu/miniconda3/envs/wiki_import/lib/python3.8/site-packages/requests/models.py", line 941, in raise_for_status
    raise HTTPError(http_error_msg, response=self)
requests.exceptions.HTTPError: 400 Client Error: Bad Request for url: http://wiki.local/rest/api/content/1302093

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "do.py", line 94, in main
    w.update_or_create(parent_id=parent_id, title=title,
  File "/data/home/davendu/miniconda3/envs/wiki_import/lib/python3.8/site-packages/atlassian/confluence.py", line 1191, in update_or_create
    result = self.update_page(parent_id=parent_id, page_id=page_id, title=title, body=body,
  File "/data/home/davendu/miniconda3/envs/wiki_import/lib/python3.8/site-packages/atlassian/confluence.py", line 1061, in update_page
    raise ApiValueError(
TypeError: 'ApiValueError' object is not callable
```

I checked the commit log and found the commit dc0917f3e76834d681c3e5a794fb4a671002288c  is the root cause. For example:

```
@@ -212,7 +212,7 @@ def get_page_by_id(self, page_id, expand=None, status=None, version=None):
                 raise ApiError(
                     "There is no content with the given id, "
                     "or the calling user does not have permission to view the content"
-                ) from e
+                )(e)
 
             raise
```

The original `raise...from...` syntax supported by Python 3 is replaced to this strange format, which is neither supported by Python 2 nor Python 3:

```
➜ python3 -c 'raise ValueError("test")(EnvironmentError("nope"))'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: 'ValueError' object is not callable


➜ python2 -c 'raise ValueError("test")(EnvironmentError("nope"))'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: 'exceptions.ValueError' object is not callable

➜ python3 -c 'raise ValueError("test") from EnvironmentError("nope")'
OSError: nope

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
ValueError: test
```

Should we return an function instead of `Exception` object for `APIError` class? Or we should just drop support for Python 2? Considering it has already been discouraged to use.

items.title: [Jira] Difficulty debugging HTTP 400 errors.
items.body:
When making a call to `jira.issue_create`, the library throws an exception when the request is invalid like the following:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "migrate_migration_board.py", line 128, in <module>
    resp = jira.issue_create(fields=subtask_fields)
  File "/Users/jkodroff/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/excel-to-jira-lAm77rlV-py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/atlassian/jira.py", line 1047, in issue_create
    return self.post(url, data={'fields': fields})
  File "/Users/jkodroff/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/excel-to-jira-lAm77rlV-py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/atlassian/rest_client.py", line 192, in post
    response = self.request('POST', path=path, data=data, headers=headers, files=files, params=params,
  File "/Users/jkodroff/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/excel-to-jira-lAm77rlV-py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/atlassian/rest_client.py", line 161, in request
    response.raise_for_status()
  File "/Users/jkodroff/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/excel-to-jira-lAm77rlV-py3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/requests/models.py", line 941, in raise_for_status
    raise HTTPError(http_error_msg, response=self)
requests.exceptions.HTTPError: 400 Client Error:  for url: https://REDACTED.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue
```

I'm guessing that the response from the JIRA server contains a more detailed error message in the response, which would help me debug the actual problem, but I can't figure out how to access the response body.

Could you provide an example on how to get additional information out of the exception?

items.title: Service Desk API Inconsistency
items.body:
Some of the methods in the service desk class return the entire api response and some return the value field in the api response. For example, the get_service_desks method is only returning the values field of the body,
https://github.com/atlassian-api/atlassian-python-api/blob/ff593ed0e56352cad9f88ada6ed336916c774158/atlassian/service_desk.py#L29
and the get_organization method is returning the entire body
https://github.com/atlassian-api/atlassian-python-api/blob/ff593ed0e56352cad9f88ada6ed336916c774158/atlassian/service_desk.py#L277
while both contain the value field in the response. I believe this introduces unnecessary inconsistency to the api and believe that all should follow the same pattern.

items.title: advanced_mode for service_desk failing
items.body:
Hi,

I tried to use advanced mode for Jira Service Desk. Got an issue with get_service_desks. Using it showed the following error: 
e.cls:[AttributeError], e.bytes:['Response' object has no attribute 'get'],

May I suggest to replace it with:
```
def get_service_desks(self):
    """
        Returns all service desks in the Jira Service Desk application
        with the option to include archived service desks

        :return: Service Desks
        """
    service_desks_list = self.get('rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk')
    if self.advanced_mode:
        return service_desks_list.json().get('values')
    else:
        return service_desks_list.get('values')
```

Also have quite same issue in get_organisations but did not have time to dig into it

items.title: jira.issue_create_or_update bug
items.body:
In the function issue_create_or_update of the jira api, on the 5th line :
del fields["issuekey"] 
fails if there is no issuekey
it shall instead do
fields.pop("issuekey",None)
In the same way as the get in the begining on the function

there is an easy work arround for users: 
Always populate the "issuekey" in your fields dictionary with None by default.

I'm attempting to use this to interface with an internal Confluence system and although I have python correctly interacting through the proxy via environment variables I still get the following stacktrace:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\dev\WinPython-64bit-3720\python-3.7.2.amd64\lib\site-packages\urllib3\connectionpool.py", line 594, in urlopen
    self._prepare_proxy(conn)
  File "C:\dev\WinPython-64bit-3720\python-3.7.2.amd64\lib\site-packages\urllib3\connectionpool.py", line 805, in _prepare_proxy
    conn.connect()
  File "C:\dev\WinPython-64bit-3720\python-3.7.2.amd64\lib\site-packages\urllib3\connection.py", line 344, in connect
    ssl_context=context)
  File "C:\dev\WinPython-64bit-3720\python-3.7.2.amd64\lib\site-packages\urllib3\util\ssl_.py", line 344, in ssl_wrap_socket
    return context.wrap_socket(sock, server_hostname=server_hostname)
  File "C:\dev\WinPython-64bit-3720\python-3.7.2.amd64\lib\ssl.py", line 412, in wrap_socket

items.body:
Hi all,

I'm trying to get the merge commit (hash) of a merged pull request.

The BitBucket API 2 has such a field: https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D

The BitBucket API 1 appareantly not: https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/rest/5.16.0/bitbucket-rest.html

Anyone having a clue how this could be done?

items.title: [Confluence] AttributeError: 'Response' object has no attribute 'get' in update_page in advanced mode
items.body:
Hi,
I get an error while calling `Confluence.update_page`  in advanced mode:
```
  File "/.../venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/atlassian/confluence.py", line 705, in update_page
    if self.is_page_content_is_already_updated(page_id, body):
  File "/.../venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/atlassian/confluence.py", line 665, in is_page_content_is_already_updated
    confluence_content = (((self.get_page_by_id(page_id, expand='body.storage') or {})
AttributeError: 'Response' object has no attribute 'get'
```
looks like  code at [this line](https://github.com/atlassian-api/atlassian-python-api/blob/88156a507873eea75d52436f09ff872435590450/atlassian/confluence.py#L696) expects that `self.get_page_by_id` always returns `dict` object but  [AtlassianRestAPI.get](https://github.com/atlassian-api/atlassian-python-api/blob/88156a507873eea75d52436f09ff872435590450/atlassian/rest_client.py#L191) method, which is used inside of `get_page_by_id`, can also return `Response` in advanced mode or `str` in case of any errors.

items.title: DeprecationWarning invalid escape sequence from atlassian.Jira
items.body:
**Environment**:
- atlassian-python-api 1.14.5, Jira module
- python 3.7.5
- pytest 3.10.1

After adding `atlassian.Jira` to my project, I started seeing this warning in the pytest output:

```
=========================================== warnings summary ============================================
../lib/python3.7/site-packages/atlassian/jira.py:579
../lib/python3.7/site-packages/atlassian/jira.py:579: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \d
    jira_issue_regex = re.compile('[A-Z]{1,10}-\d+')

-- Docs: https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/warnings.html
================================= 3 passed, 1 warnings in 1.69 seconds ==================================
```

The answer to this Stackoverflow [question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50504500/deprecationwarning-invalid-escape-sequence-what-to-use-instead-of-d)  advocates using a raw string instead of a Unicode string as the argument to `re.compile`.

Modifying line 529 of `jira.py` to:

```
    jira_issue_regex = re.compile(r'[A-Z]{1,10}-\d+')
```

fixes the warning in pytest.

items.title: Execute Build function always returns None response after triggering the build in Bamboo
items.body:
I faced this issue and on debugging I found that the headers in the _execute_build_ function in _bamboo.py_ is setting the HTML headers in the _post_ request and then trying to convert the response into json using .json() method that always fails and catch block returns the _None_ response.

I fixed this error by changing the below in the _execute_build_ function. 
From : **headers = self.form_token_headers**
To: _headers = self.default_headers_

Could you please review and fix in the code?

Please note that I am getting permission errors while pushing this change so raised an issue for you guys. please see to it. 

Thanks
Lakhan

items.title: [Bitbucket] Merge a Pull Request using bitbucket.py?
items.body:
I'm loving the python interface so far, but there's one thing I can't seem to do using function calls in `bitbucket.py` -- merge a pull request. Is this just not supported? It appears to exist as a functionality in [the bitbucket REST API](https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/rest/6.8.0/bitbucket-rest.html), with this form: 
```
/rest/api/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos/{repositorySlug}/pull-requests/{pullRequestId}/merge?version
```
Just wondering if I'm missing something. Can/should I use `AtlassianRestAPI::post` to directly POST the URL I need?

Nice project and thanks in advance!

items.title: [Jira] bulk_issue endless recursion
items.body:
I got this, then user pass a few invalid keys, and none of them are in Jira. Example JQL values:

> key in ("TEST-f4123", "TEST-14g334g", "fdf34f")


Function in jira.py:
```    
def bulk_issue(self, issue_list, fields='*all'):
        """
        :param fields:
        :param list issue_list:
        :return:
        """
        missing_issues = list()
        jql = 'key in ({})'.format(', '.join(['"{}"'.format(key) for key in issue_list]))
        query_result = self.jql(jql, fields=fields)
        if 'errorMessages' in query_result.keys():
            for message in query_result['errorMessages']:
                for key in issue_list:
                    if key in message:
                        missing_issues.append(key)
                        issue_list.remove(key)
            query_result, missing_issues = self.bulk_issue(issue_list, fields)
        return query_result, missing_issues
```

So it goes to `issue_list.remove(key)`, removes invalid keys one by one and enters endless recursion cycle on line 516 with following error:

`Error in JQL Query: Expecting either a value, list or function but got \')\'. You must surround \')\' in quotation marks to use it as a value. (line 1, character 9)`

items.title: [Question] - how to properly segment out connection
items.body:
Not sure how to ask this but I can authenticate with OAuth fine if i just write the script from top down. I wanted to make it a bit cleaner by separating out the connection piece in a separate class/module and importing that into my main module. I did something like...

`from atlassian import Jira
import os

 class JiraAccount(Jira):
 def __init__(self):
 super().__init__():
self.access = os.environ['ACCESS_KEY']
self.secret = os.environ['SECRET_KEY']

key_cert = None
key_file = "path\to\rsa.pem"
with open(key_file, "r") as key_cert_data:
    key_cert = key_cert_data.read()

oauth_dict = {
        'access_token': CLIENT_ACCESS,
        'access_token_secret': CLIENT_SECRET,
        'consumer_key': 'get-jira-issue',
        'key_cert': key_cert
    }

 jira = Jira(url="jira_server_url", oauth=oauth_dict)
 return jira
`

Then in my main module i'd do something like

jira = JiraAccount()

But then I get some error about JiraAccount not being an iterable. If i just threw the above code into a regular function in my main module, things work okay...

items.title: tempo_timesheets_get_worklogs by epic or issue

items.title: Atlassian-Cloud Integration
items.body:
I have some questions about this project in combination with Atlassian cloud.

It looks like there are hardcoded api versions and paths in the bitbucket module.
e.g. 
`        url = 'rest/api/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos?limit=1000'.format(
            projectKey=project_key)
        return self.get(url)
`
this seems to be not compatible with bitbucket cloud.

I also did not find any implementation for oauth2, which would also help to use the cloud services.

Am I missing something?
If not, are there a plan to implement this project for cloud services?

items.title: Issue with requests with data=null
items.body:
We are migrating to some new version of Confluence (to work on cloud).
I see an issue that any HTTP request with data=null (coming from files=None) is taken as bad request.
This used to be ok for our current version (setup) of Confluence.
If I fix rest_client to be:

data='' if not data else json.dumps(data)

Instead of current code:
data = json.dumps(data)

then it works for me.
Is this a known issue? Does it make sense?

items.title: bamboo max-result url param
items.body:
Looking at the Bamboo class in bamboo.py most the calls are passing max_results=25 kwarg to the base_list_call which converts this to a max-results param. Trying to override this does not change the number of results returned.

Looking at the bamboo api documentation (https://developer.atlassian.com/server/bamboo/bamboo-rest-resources/) the proper param should be 'max-result' (ex: /rest/api/latest/project?max-result=10)

items.title: Bug in setup.cfg of 1.13.31 that causes install on Mac OS failed
items.body:
setup.cfg uses " 'win' in sys.platform " to identify Windows or non-Windows, but MacOS is special, it's considered Windows by mistake.
```
>>> sys.platform
'darwin'
```
Please check, thanks

items.title: setup.py script dependency on pywin32 breaks on Mac
items.body:
I believe the setup.py modifications and kerberos integration introduced starting with [this commit](https://github.com/atlassian-api/atlassian-python-api/commit/2170f270e16765bd810b20b3d418e22cd1f894de) broke things for me. This includes the updated master branch. 

See the output from the failed pip3 install below.

```
Collecting pywin32 (from kerberos-sspi->atlassian-python-api->-r requirements.txt (line 2))
  Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement pywin32 (from kerberos-sspi->atlassian-python-api->-r requirements.txt (line 2)) (from versions: )
No matching distribution found for pywin32 (from kerberos-sspi->atlassian-python-api->-r requirements.txt (line 2))
```

I had to put this in requirements.txt to make it work (note: the commit I am referring to is pre-Kerberos integration):

```text
git+https://github.com/atlassian-api/atlassian-python-api@e14475ed3aca9de71c8a8954911d8c7a2a3942ea#egg=atlassian-python-api
```

I have a workaround right now but please fix. Thanks

items.title: [Confluence] Add method to move Confluence documents between spaces
items.body:
I needed the ability to move a bunch of pages from one Space to another in Confluence and it is very poorly supported it seems. Thankfully, I found a way to do it, so sharing this in hopes someone else will find it useful (and/or maybe you can officially support it).

```
from atlassian import Confluence

confluence = Confluence(url='YOUR_INSTANCE_URL',
                 username='YOUR_USERNAME',
                 password='YOUR_API_KEY')

page_id = '' # ID of the page you want to move
space_key = '' # the Space key of the destination Space
title = '' # The title of the new parent page in the destination Space

confluence.get("/pages/movepage.action?pageId=%s&spaceKey=%s&targetTitle=%s&position=append" % (page_id, space_key, title),
                  headers={'x-atlassian-token': 'no-check'}
                 )
```

If you are doing it in a script, I highly recommend adding a `time.sleep(5)` after the move call otherwise you will get errors occasionally (I also tested with a sleep of 2 seconds, but got a few errors, but never any with a sleep of 5).

Reference: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/Move-Page-Confluence-Rest-API/qaq-p/503204

items.title: [Confluence] Index Error when looking up page by title
Support for Kerberos authentication
items.body:
I see there is support for both `Basic` and `OAuth1` authentication into the Atlassian products.  For those folks who have installed Kerberos SSO support (from `Kantega` in this case), would it be possible to support automatic logon?  This assumes that `curl` in the system path supports it:

*GSS-Negotiate* is the most important option to build in to Curl.

```
$ curl --version
curl 7.29.0 (x86_64-redhat-linux-gnu) libcurl/7.29.0 NSS/3.36 zlib/1.2.7 libidn/1.28 libssh2/1.4.3
Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher http https imap imaps ldap ldaps pop3 pop3s rtsp scp sftp smtp smtps telnet tftp
Features: AsynchDNS GSS-Negotiate IDN IPv6 Largefile NTLM NTLM_WB SSL libz unix-sockets

$ curl -v --negotiate -u : https://wiki.example.com/login.action
```

The successful result of this is a `Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=$COOKIE; Path=/; HttpOnly` HTTP header; likely the same as the output the other authenticators.

items.title: Unable to query JIRA as URL is suffixed with '/wiki'
items.body:
Using `atlassian-python-api==1.13.28`

Our JIRA instance is accessible at https://company.atlassian.net/ and Confluence at https://company.atlassian.net/wiki.

After the commit https://github.com/atlassian-api/atlassian-python-api/commit/d4e843b20ea7e91873aac95529b8513e3b62aae2#diff-a519e0301a0f249eae8b763ced476674, we are unable to query for data because the rest client automatically suffixes `/wiki` to the URL we pass in for communicating with JIRA.

On reverting this change, our scripts start working again.

**Expected**:

```
curl --user user@email.com:token 'https://company.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/JEDI-18821?fields=*all'
{"expand":"renderedFields,names,schema,operations,editmeta,changelog,versionedRepresentations",
"id":"99725",
"self":"https://company.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/99725",
"key":"JEDI-18821"
...
...
```

**Actual**:

```
>>> jira = Jira('https://company.atlassian.net/', 'user@email.com', 'token')
>>> jira.issue('JEDI-18821')
{'message': 'null for uri: https://company.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/2/issue/JEDI-18821?fields=*all', 
'status-code': 404}
```

items.title: Confluence delete_attachment_by_id doesn't work
items.body:
Confluence method `delete_attachment_by_id` doesn't work:

```python
>>> res = con.get_attachments_from_content(27410959)
>>> att = res['results'][0]
>>> att['id']
'att27411717'
>>> con.delete_attachment_by_id(att['id'], None) # nothing happens
```

Nothing happens. If I use the `delete_attachment` method everything works:

```python
>>> con.delete_attachment(27410959, att['id'], None)
{'errorMessage': 'You are not permitted to perform this operation.'}
```

It's correct here, the user doesn't have permissions to delete attachments. If it had the permission, the latter method would work (checked). And the prior wouldn't (checked too)

items.title: HTTP 400 when using get_all_pages_by_label
items.body:
When trying to using get_all_pages_by_label I get an HTTP 400 error returned from confluence. It looks like this is because the parameters are being url encoded twice:

`DEBUG:urllib3.connectionpool:https://confluence:8090 "GET /confluence/rest/api/content/search?cql=type%3Dpage%2520AND%2520label%3Dtestlabel&limit=50`

The parameters should be:

`cql=type%3Dpage%20AND%20label%3Dtestlabel`

(i.e. the % in %20 is being encoded as %25)

items.title: Patch version breaks API
items.body:
Upgrading from 1.13.15 to 1.13.24, calls to update_page with positional arguments are broken. The parameters were reordered: `parent_id` was moved towards the end.

With 1.13.15 the function signature was:
`def update_page(self, parent_id, page_id, title, body, type='page', representation='storage', minor_edit=False):`

With 1.13.24 (and probably earlier) it now is instead:
`def update_page(self, page_id, title, body, parent_id=None, type='page', representation='storage', minor_edit=False):`

The commit where the reordering happened was bfdb7194dae560449ca69196b05d4ede1f1dcce7

items.title: Confluence.get_page_by_title() should be work similar to Confluence.get_page_by_id()
items.body:
As user I expect that `Confluence.get_page_by_title()` and `Confluence.get_page_by_id()` works very similar and returns the same result. At the moment both function are different.

- `Confluence.get_page_by_id()` allows me to customize the `expand` parameter, `Confluence.get_page_by_title()` not

If I had only the title and I need additional page attributes like content I have to call `confluence.get_page_by_title()` to get the page id. With the page id and the expand parameter I can call `confluence.get_page_by_id()` to get the content. 

**Changes/Improvement**
- Add parameter `expand` to function `confluence.get_page_by_title()` 
- Remove parameters `start` and `limit` from function `confluence.get_page_by_title()`. Both parameters are useless, because only the first result is returned. 
- Reduce the data transfer by set rest-api parameter `limit` fix to 1 for the rest api call in `confluence.get_page_by_title()`

**Examples**
Both functions `Confluence.get_page_by_title()` and `Confluence.get_page_by_id()` return equal data in the default case.
```
page_a = confluence.get_page_by_title(space, title)
page_b = confluence.get_page_by_id(page_a['id'])
```

Get content from a page if you have only the space and page name. You have to call two function. First call to get the page id from page name and the second function to get the content
```
page_id = confluence.get_page_id(space, title) # get_page_id calls get_page_by_title()
page_c = confluence.get_page_by_id(page_id,expand='body.storage,version')
print(page_c['body']['storage']['value'])
```

After the improvement you can do this by one call
```
page_c = confluence.get_page_by_title(space, title, expand='body.storage,version')
print(page_c['body']['storage']['value'])
```

**Effects**
Changes should be backward compatible. With a little restriction: function parameter start and limit are not longer available. But the usage of the parameter make no sense. Parameter `start` have to be 0 if it used. Parameter `limit` have to be 1 or greater if it used, but without any effects. In all other cases the function will be return `None`.

In case the parameters start and limit are used you will get a type error exception (`TypeError: get_page_by_title() got an unexpected keyword argument 'start'`)

**Additional**
```
def get_page_by_title(self, space, title, start=None, limit=None):
    """
    Returns the list of labels on a piece of Content.
    :param space: Space key
    :param title: Title of the page
    :param start: OPTIONAL: The start point of the collection to return. Default: None (0).
    :param limit: OPTIONAL: The limit of the number of labels to return, this may be restricted by
                        fixed system limits. Default: 200.
    :return: The JSON data returned from searched results the content endpoint, or the results of the
             callback. Will raise requests.HTTPError on bad input, potentially.
             If it has IndexError then return the None.
    """
```

```
def get_page_by_id(self, page_id, expand=None):
    """
    Get page by ID
    :param page_id: Content ID
    :param expand: OPTIONAL: expand e.g. history
    :return:
```

items.title: Make method confluence.attach_file() more flexible
items.body:
**Description of the improvements**
With following two improvements makes the method `confluence.attach_file()` more flexible. Both improvments will be very easly implemented if the implemenation of `confluence.attach_file()` based on `confluence.attach_content()` (see #280).

**Improvement 1: Attachment name regardless from filename**
The new optional parameter named `name` (type string) gives the caller the freedom to specifies the name of the attachment which is not based on the filename.  Benefit: Name of the attachment and the name of the file becomes independent.

If parameter name not given the method use the existing method to extract the attachment name from the file name.

**Improvement 2: Content type regardless from file extension**
The new optional parameter named `content_type` (type string) gives the caller the freedom to specify the HTTP content type of the of the attachment regardless to the extension of the file. 

If parameter content_type not given the method use the existing method to specify the content type by the file name extension.

items.title: confluence.attach_file() can not upload a new version of an attached file
items.body:
**Bug description**
If I try to upload a new version of an attached file with the function `confluence.attach_file()` nothing happend. Upload a completly new file the function works as expected. 

**Bug reason**
The bug based of two parts:
* The complete file name (including path) is used as name of the attachment if a new file is upload.
* The base file name (without path) is used to check if a attachment with this name already exists and upload a new version of the file.
=> The check if the file already exists fails and the function tries to upload a new file. This fails because the file already exists.

**Solution**
- Use the base file name as attachment name at the inital file upload

**Screenshot**
A screenshot of the attachments. The first attachment is uploaded by `confluence.attach_file()` the second attachment by hand.
![confluence_attachment_list](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53021429/61436204-9b499980-a93a-11e9-851e-a975a49e98c4.png)

I can retrieve body.storage data when using the get_page_by_id() method.  Is this a bug or am I doing something wrong.

items.title: Workaround limitation of 1000 in csv export for Jira
items.body: I appreciate Jira 8.2 and upwards allow the config to be edited to increase the limitation of 1000 for the CSV export, but is there a way to iterate over this (aggregate the csv) if the user requests the limit above 1000?  Our Jira server is current on version 8 and upgrades are slow progress in our business so I wondered if this could easily be handled in the python call.

items.title: Deleting a Confluence page label
items.body: How can I delete a Confluence page label?  I can see how to retrieve and add labels but it is not clear how to remove a label.

items.title: Only getting string XML responses
items.body:
I'm trying to list out the pages in our space. I confirmed 'DA' is the space name by looking at the URL while in that space and spaceKey did equal 'DA' so I know the space exists. 

It seems like no matter what method I call, I only get a string version of the XML for the main page of the Confluence account.

```
confluence = Confluence(url=URL, username=USERNAME, password=PASSWORD, verify_ssl=ssl_path)
confluence.get_all_pages_from_space(space='DA')
```

Error output for every method I call:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "initial_connection_test.py", line 14, in <module>
    confluence.get_all_pages_from_space(space='DA')
  File "/Users/jcatoe/.virtualenvs/v37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/atlassian/confluence.py", line 220, in get_all_pages_from_space
    return (self.get(url, params=params) or {}).get('results')
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'get'
```

items.title: Delete Permissions for Bitbucket
items.body: Please add the feature to delete users/groups from projects and repositories.

items.title: Key error on file upload
items.body:
When attempting to upload a file to a page, i'm getting the following error:

 File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/atlassian/confluence.py", line 389, in attach_file
    if attachments['size']:
KeyError: 'size'

just using the line:
confluence.attach_file("new_logo.jpg", page_id="169476394", title="TEST", space="TEST", comment="Testing Attachments")

items.title: Blog posts in Confluence trash is not deleted
items.body:
Hi guys!

This is an amazing tool. I just tested this function:

`confluence.remove_page_from_trash(page_id)`

It removes the pages as the name says, but the problem is that Confluence got different content types, meaning that deleted blog posts in trash is not deleted only the deleted pages. Is it possible to develop functionality for deleting the posts too?

It would be amazing if that was possible. Then i will go ahead and configure our server with an automatic scheduler for running this job every week, cleaning up the Confluence instance for trashed items. :)

Thanks in advance!

Hello, 
Is there an option to construct the authorization header and supply it using this api instead of oauth and username/pass? As it is explained here https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/basic-authentication/ (Base64 encoding)

items.title: Behind corporate proxy
items.body:
# Description

I'm under windows and behind a corporate proxy, with an on premise Jira instance. My worsktation is globally using a proxy, and in my case it causes a lot of trouble when I try to interact with the API.

```python
from atlassian import Jira

jira = Jira(
    url='https://jira.intranet.opt/',
    username='MY_LOGIN',
    password='MY_PASSWORD')

JQL = 'project = MYPROJECT AND status NOT IN (Closed, Resolved) ORDER BY issuekey'
data = jira.jql(JQL)
print(data)
```

Running this code leads me the following stacktrace :

```
Windows PowerShell
Copyright (C) 2016 Microsoft Corporation. Tous droits réservés.

PS C:\Users\MY_LOGIN> & C:/Python37/python.exe c:/Users/MY_LOGIN/Desktop/jira.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\urllib3\connectionpool.py", line 597, in urlopen
    self._prepare_proxy(conn)
  File "C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\urllib3\connectionpool.py", line 807, in _prepare_proxy
    conn.connect()
  File "C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\urllib3\connection.py", line 324, in connect
    self._tunnel()
  File "C:\Python37\lib\http\client.py", line 911, in _tunnel
    message.strip()))
OSError: Tunnel connection failed: 503 Service Unavailable

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\requests\adapters.py", line 449, in send
    timeout=timeout
  File "C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\urllib3\connectionpool.py", line 641, in urlopen
    _stacktrace=sys.exc_info()[2])
  File "C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\urllib3\util\retry.py", line 399, in increment
    raise MaxRetryError(_pool, url, error or ResponseError(cause))
urllib3.exceptions.MaxRetryError: HTTPSConnectionPool(host='jira.intranet.opt', port=443): Max retries exceeded with url: /rest/api/2/search?startAt=0&fields=%2Aall&jql=project+%3D+MYPROJECT+AND+status+NOT+IN+%28Closed%2C+Resolved%29+ORDER+BY+issuekey (Caused by ProxyError('Cannot connect to proxy.', OSError('Tunnel connection failed: 503 Service Unavailable')))

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:/Users/MY_LOGIN/Desktop/jira.py", line 9, in <module>
    data = jira.jql(JQL)
  File "C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\atlassian\jira.py", line 79, in jql
    return self.get('rest/api/2/search', params=params)
  File "C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\atlassian\rest_client.py", line 173, in get
    trailing=trailing)
  File "C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\atlassian\rest_client.py", line 120, in request
    files=files
  File "C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\requests\sessions.py", line 533, in request
    resp = self.send(prep, **send_kwargs)
  File "C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\requests\sessions.py", line 646, in send
    r = adapter.send(request, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\requests\adapters.py", line 510, in send
    raise ProxyError(e, request=request)
requests.exceptions.ProxyError: HTTPSConnectionPool(host='jira.intranet.opt', port=443): Max retries exceeded with url: /rest/api/2/search?startAt=0&fields=%2Aall&jql=project+%3D+MYPROJECT+AND+status+NOT+IN+%28Closed%2C+Resolved%29+ORDER+BY+issuekey (Caused by ProxyError('Cannot connect to proxy.', OSError('Tunnel connection failed: 503 Service Unavailable')))
```

# Action

Please explain how to programmatically tell to the `Python` script not to use local proxy settings (Internet Explorer's one).

Thank you in advance for your help. 🙏

items.title: Bitbucket API v2
items.body:
Hello,

It seems that Bitbucket removed the version 1 of their API on May 29. I cannot make it work. ¿Is it planned to update the api client to version 2?

Thanks

items.title: get_page_by_id has expand parameter handling bug
items.body:
https://github.com/atlassian-api/atlassian-python-api/blob/6a3629d0a91afe5495c70a334761521fcbc87f06/atlassian/confluence.py#L121

The quotes are missing around `expand` as key in the dictionary entry. This makes the key to be equivalent to the value and the properties will not be expanded.

It should be 
`params = {'expand': expand} `
instead.

I have checked other possible mistakes of this kind in the file, but there are none. In other cases, the parameter was handle correctly, either through format operators or because it was expressed as
`params['expand'] = expand`
when it was not the only parameter to set.

items.title: can't connect to confluence
items.body:
This work for me
```
    s = requests.Session()
    s.auth = (CONFLUENCE_USER,CONFLUENCE_PASS)
    s.headers.update({'Content-Type': 'application/json','Accept': 'application/json'})
    r = s.get('https://test.com/rest/api/content/242541850?expand=None')
    pprint.pprint(r.text)
```
result
```
DEBUG:urllib3.connectionpool:Starting new HTTPS connection (1): wiki.grab.com:443
DEBUG:urllib3.connectionpool:https://test.com:443 "GET /rest/api/content/242541850?expand=None HTTP/1.1" 200 None
('{"id":"242541850","type":"page","status":"current","title":".....}}')
```

but this fail
```
    confluence = Confluence(
        url="https://test.com",
        username=CONFLUENCE_USER,
        password=CONFLUENCE_PASS,
    )

    r = confluence.get_page_by_id("242541850")
```
result
```
DEBUG:atlassian.rest_client:curl --silent -X GET -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'Accept: application/json'  'https://test.com/rest/api/content/242541850?expand=None'
DEBUG:urllib3.connectionpool:Starting new HTTPS connection (1): test.com:443
DEBUG:urllib3.connectionpool:https://test.com:443 "GET /rest/api/content/242541850?expand=None HTTP/1.1" 403 556
ERROR:atlassian.rest_client:Received: 403
 Forbidden. Please, check permissions
ERROR:atlassian.rest_client:Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)
```

Am I missing something?

items.title: update failing without version
items.body:
In updating a page, I am getting the error below.  Is there a way to include an increment version in the confluence.update() function?

Update: I am updating the page with MarkUp.  Plain text, works fine.

My code is as follows...

This works:
status = confluence.update_page(
    parent_id=None,
    page_id=123456,
    title='Proof of Concept',
    body = 'Some text here')

This does not work (although works fine for a create_page):
status = confluence.update_page(
    parent_id=None,
    page_id=123456,
    title='Proof of Concept',
    body={'storage': {'value': str(pageBody),'representation': 'wiki'}})

where pageBody is MarkUp

Error:
{'statusCode': 400, 'data': {'authorized': False, 'valid': True, 'allowedInReadOnlyMode': True, 'errors': [], 'successful': False}, 'message': 'Must supply an incremented version when updating Content. No version supplied.', 'reason': 'Bad Request'}

items.title: In confluence module missing /wiki in api_root
items.body:
I am using atlassian-python-api==1.12.6

This call
```python
pprint(confluence.get_space('MYSPACE'))
```
returns
`Received: 404
 Not Found
{'message': 'null for uri: '
            'https://mycompany.atlassian.net/rest/api/space/MYSPACE?expand=description.plain,homepage',
 'status-code': 404}`

And indeed, the [API docs](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-space-get) says that the api root is **wiki**/rest/api and not rest/api. 
Overriding the api_root did not change anything:
```python
Confluence(username=user,
           password=api_token,
           api_root='wiki/rest/api',
           url='https://mycompany.atlassian.net'
```
But the return value of get_space() is the same.

Could you please check / suggest?
